Friendly owner/host.  10 mins to tube and only 2 stops from Stratford, the main Olympics site and Westfield, largest shopping  centre in Europe (apparently!).  There is every shop imaginable (257), 77 restaurants, cinemas, bowling alley, and a casino!   Guests can help themselves to tea and coffee, and bread for breakfast.  It's provided free of charge (as I am not licensed to sell food - most people tend to want to buy their own).   The neighbourhood is stable, quiet and peaceful, with nice, large Victorian and Edwardian houses.  Alfred Hitchcock was born and lived in Leytonstone!  As well as David Beckham of course! The local area (including Wanstead, very close) has lots of pubs, cafes, restaurants, shops.   It is 15 minutes by train to the hustle and bustle of Central London (Central Line, to Liverpool Street) and 30 minutes to Oxford Street.  The bedrooms

properties.neighborhood_overview: It's very close to City of London, a walk to Stratford and huge shopping complex, Olympic pool and park.  We are opposite Epping forest.  So it's peaceful, yet close to city. There are a few cafes and bars.  My favourite are Horizon, All you Read is Love.  The Marrakech (next door to Sainsbury) is also nice and reasonably priced.  All have free wifi.  All have nice cakes! Red Lion pub is opposite the Horizon Cafe on Leytonstone High Road.  Quite nice food (bit over-priced in my opinion), but great area out the back with cinema screenings. Shops/food, main ones are: -Sainsbury - right outside the tube station, about minute away.  Open till 11pm -Asian 24 hour supermarket - right opposite the tube station as you come out -Tesco 24 hour supermarket - Gainsborough Road, behind McDonalds which is on Leytonstone High Road. Wanstead is close-by with lots of shops bars, cafes and restaurants.  It's about a 15 minute walk.
properties.notes: CAR SERVICE AVAILABLE.  Please ask for quote or order as needed by text. Stratford Station to house £10 Stansted Airport to house £50 Heathrow Airport to house £50 Gatwick Airport to house £65 Close to Westfield, huge indoor shopping mall with restaurants, cinemas, bowling, Olympic stadium (soon to be West Ham football ground), Olympic swimming pool now public. OYSTER CARD I provide Oyster card with £5 loaded onto card.
properties.transit: The house is about 10-12 minutes walk to tube (Leytonstone, Central Line).  There are also buses and night bus outside KFC on the corner of Leytonstone High Road and Harvey Road. The Night Tube will be running all night on Fridays and Saturdays from August 2016. If you need a taxi service, please let me know and I can book for you.  I use Goldline.  I also use Uber.  I can book this for you, get the price and you provide the cash to me. You can also book and pay for a taxi online for services from Heathrow.  It's very reasonably priced for a group of people and bags.
properties.access: Kitchen Living room Garden (back and front) Bathroom Dining Room (French doors to back garden)
properties.interaction: Depends!  People vary in their preferences.  I am friendly and approachable, I love having a chat.  Often though guests may also want to do their own thing.  I am very flexible.  I just want you to relax and enjoy your stay!
properties.house_rules: If washing at the kitchen sink, please be careful of the cold water top.  It's very strong and sends water behind the taps (wooden work bench)!   Also, the wooden benchtop in the kitchen is plain wood so need to place any items on the glass covers and tea-towel covers provided. I have never had a problem with noisy or disrespectful guests, so I just trust people to know what to do!

properties.summary: Self contained lodgings on the first floor (2nd USA) of this house: double bedroom,  cupboards/shelves, en-suite shower/toilet, open plan sitting room/kitchen.Next to Hyde Park, Kensington Park, Lancaster Gate; near to Paddington Station/Heathrow Airport Express and Oxford Street/Marble Arch and Notting Hill/Portobello Road. Secluded, quaint mews street in centre of London. Great transportation links.
properties.space: Welcome Dear Guest A double bedroom, with en-suite shower room/sink/toilet, open plan sitting room and kitchen on the first floor. Perfectly located for central London; 3 storey home in a quiet and quaint, traditional cobbled street (Mews) next to Hyde Park. Quick and easy access to the bustling West End in one direction and Notting Hill in the other, yet next to the relaxing open spaces of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. Regents Park is also close by and Buckingham Palace and Camden Market are just a few tube stops away. *Please note: *Only bookings showing a photo of the guest will be accepted.  *The price does vary according to season. *Don't try to walk to the house with large wheelie bags. The cobble stones make it difficult. Better to take a taxi. Small wheelie bags are OK. *First floor/story in the UK is the equivalent of second floor in the USA. *There is no lift * Due to a back injury I am unable to help you carry heavy bags up the stairs Property Description Recently re-bui

properties.access: You share a common entrance to the house with me (I live on the ground/lower ground floors) but your lodging is on the first floor and is separate and private. This is in keeping with the original concept of AirBnB where guests live in someones' house/property.
properties.interaction: I always try to be at the property in person to welcome you on arrival. After that it is up to you. I am always happy to assist with knowledge of where to go and what to do in London
properties.house_rules: Relaxed. No smoking in the house but there is a bench/table under the olive tree, in front of the house, that you are welcome to use for smoking. Minimum 3 nights stay Would greatly appreciate being informed as to your estimated time of arrival when making an enquiry/reservation.  Not obligatory but would appreciate shoes being removed inside hallway. Baggage can be left after check out time (11.00 am) if your flight/train is not until later in the day.
properties.host_about:
Educated in England but born in Kenya and lived in India, Bangladesh, Dubai, Qatar, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Singapore, USA and France. I have lived in London for the past 13 years. So I do know what it is to be a traveller and how a friendly face with local knowledge can be an added bonus to your trip.

I run my own little company from a home office on the ground floor of the house and thoroughly enjoy the area and all that it has to offer. The street must be one of the most friendly streets in London with neighbours sitting outside in the summer, drinking wine, BBQs etc

properties.space: The flat is in a modern block with great security. There is s small balcony off the lounge. There is a park opposite the block and Tesco Express is 2 mins away and there are nearby cafes and bars. This is a great base to explore the fashionable  areas of Hoxton and Spitalfields which offer some of London's most vibrant night life.

properties.summary: Your home from home near Portobello Market, this cosy studio is the ideal space to stay for a trip of sightseeing, and is within easy reach of London’s top destinations. Easy access to the West End and Hyde Park. Fully stocked kitchen and bathroom.

The studio has a double platform bed in order to maximise space. It has its own private bathroom but please note that the bathroom is just across the hall. properties.neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill is one of the most iconic areas of London and is without a doubt the ideal place to stay in London. The famous Portobello Market is just a three minute walk from the flat, selling antiquities, clothes and street-food. The area is a hub of traditional English pubs, cool bars and quality restaurants. It is also very central making it easy to access other parts of London. Notting Hill is a relaxed and safe area where you will feel comfortable walking home from the tube station at night. There is so much choice on Portobello Rd, and below are just a few of my favourite places to eat and drink. In the flat, there are many more recommendations, complete with maps showing you exactly how to get there. Butter Bakery : right across the road, has a brilliant selection of pastries for breakfast or a snack, with aromatic coffee and fresh juices. Ripe Tomato : a family-run restaurant just round the corner which serves fantastic Italian food. Make sure you leave room for pudding!  Raoul
properties.notes: If you are checking in after 6pm, I might ask that you come to my house first to collect the keys (my house is on the same road as the flat, just 5 mins walk away). If I am at home in the evening, I will come and meet you at the flat.  The flat is on the second floor and there is no lift so you do have a few stairs to climb. Please do not smoke in the flat. I ask that you treat the flat as you would your home. I am happy for you to have friends over for a meal, and enjoy the flat but please leave it clean and tidy. Unfortunately we cannot allow dogs (even though we love them!)
properties.transit: Westbourne Park station is a five minute walk, and takes you to areas such as Paddington, Baker Street, Euston Square, Kings Cross/St Pancras, and Liverpool Street.  Notting Hill Gate station is a ten minute walk, and from there you have a choice of three underground lines, taking you almost anywhere in London!  There are also plenty of buses if you prefer the scenic route. I have been travelling round London my whole life so if you want to know the best way to get somewhere, just ask me! From the flat you can easily get to: Portobello Market (3 min walk) Madame Tussauds (15 mins by tube) Kensington Palace (20 min walk) Hyde Park (20 min walk) Buckingham Palace (30 min by tube) Natural History Museum (20 min by bus) Science Museum (20 min by bus) Kings Cross St Pancras (15 min by tube) Oxford Street (30 min by bus) Soho (35 min by bus) Harrods (30 min by tube) Westminster Abbey / Big Ben (25 min by tube) St Paul’s Cathedral (30 min by tube) The London Eye (35 min by tube) Tate Modern /
properties.access: The entire flat is for our guests only. The flat is on the second floor and there is no lift. Check in is 2pm and check out is 11am. I will try and be flexible but it completely depends on availability. If the flat is clean earlier than 2pm we would be happy for you to arrive early, and likewise with checkout. Just ask!
properties.interaction: I will come and meet you with keys (before 6pm - if you arrive after 6pm I might ask that you collect the keys from my house which is on the same road, depending on my availability), and will always be on hand for any help you need, or any recommendations you would like about the surrounding area.  Check in and out times are flexible depending on availability, so just ask and I will try and accommodate when possible. If I am away on holiday or away for the weekend, I will also ask that you pick up keys from my house, regardless of arrival time.
properties.house_rules: The building contains other flats, so we do ask that you are quiet during the late hours of the night.
properties.host_about:
Hi! I'm Jessie, a born-and-bred Londoner living in Notting Hill with my little rescue dog, Roman. I love horse riding, experimenting with my hair colour (currently blue!) and also travelling.

So far some of my favourite countries are Iceland, Ethiopia, Palestine and Japan. This year I'll be visiting Panjab, Mongolia, Kenya, Uganda and wherever else I might find myself! 

I love my home city and have lived in the Notting Hill area my whole life, so I'm a bit of an expert on the place! As a host I hope to make you feel as at home as possible, and I am local to the flat meaning I can be on hand for whatever you need. 

Please feel free to ask me any questions - I look forward to meeting you!
properties.street: Westbourne Park Road, London, W11 1EP, United Kingdom

properties.name: Central London Apartment Zone 1
properties.summary: One bedroom apartment which is my residential home, in the heart of fashionable Angel Islington, suitable for one to two people, 10 mins into the centre of London. A few minutes walk to transport links, shops, restaurants, theatres, cinemas, pubs etc.
properties.space: What makes this space ideal is it's location in Zone 1, Central London. In addition, the flat is conveniently located in the centre of all local amenities whilst also being on a quiet square - best of both worlds! The apartment is designed with floor to ceiling windows, which means the sunlight literally floods in, especially in the mornings, so you will definitely feel like you are on holiday, although you can pull the blinds down if you prefer. For those coming from warmer climates, this is a warm home as the walls are thick and I rarely have to use any heating. At the top of the building is a roof terrace, with views across London. The Gherkin, The Shard, The BT Tower and St Paul's Cathedral are all within eyeshot. Guests will have access to a washing machine, dishwasher, Wi-Fi, and fully equipped brand new kitchen with double fridge freezer and hob/ oven. The bathroom is brand new travertine stone tiled and fitted with underfloor heating, I will be on hand to meet you at the start

properties.neighborhood_overview: Angel is a trendy, fast paced neighbourhood, you will really feel like you are part of the city. That said, there are quiet spaces, such as garden pubs, and parks nearby. You will be spoilt for choice with hundreds of restaurants and bars lining Upper Street, some of them run and owned by top chefs such as Jamie Oliver. My flat is a 2 minute walk from all of this. There is also a shopping centre 5 minutes away with a 6 screen cinema and more shops and restaurants. Also a 5 minute walk away is one of the oldest street markets in London, Chapel Market. Here you can buy fruit, vegetables, clothing, hardware, hats, bags, more or less anything really. The market is full of real London characters. It's also worth mentioning we have fabulous theatres such as The Almeida, Hen & Chickens, and The Kings Head, all a stone's throw from here.  Angel is also the location of a pub called The Camden Head, the only comedy venue in London which has free comedy shows, every night of the week.
properties.notes: The building is Grade II listed, and was founded in 1828, formerly The Royal Free Hospital, to provide free hospital care to those who couldn't afford treatment. The title 'Royal' was granted by Queen Victoria in 1837 in recognition of the hospital's work with cholera victims. It's a beautiful building, particularly imposing from the front, with many interesting architectural features. The conversion to housing was completed 20 years ago and was celebrated by the Royal Duchess of Wales who came to hold the opening ceremony. To this day the square is regarded as a flagship development of its kind, and sometimes visited by groups of tourists on historical tours.
properties.transit: You can hire cheap bikes on the street outside the property. This facility was put in place by previous London mayor Boris Johnson as a way to get people out of their cars. It's a good way to explore the area. Cycling to the West End from here would take about 20 minutes. If cycling is not your thing, then Angel Tube Station is a 6 minute walk and will take you to all London destinations. Also outside the tube station are many different buses which will take you all over London including to Piccadilly Circus, Camden, Knightsbridge, West End, and the stations Kings Cross, Victoria, Euston and Waterloo. Handy if you need to catch a train out of London. All buses are frequent, some as often as every 3 minutes.
properties.access: Guests will have access to a washing machine, dishwasher, Wi-Fi, and fully equipped brand new kitchen with double fridge freezer and hob/ oven. The bathroom is brand new travertine stone tiled and fitted with underfloor heating,
properties.interaction: I will be on hand to meet you at the start of your trip and am only a phone call away should you need anything.
properties.house_rules: I expect you to treat my home with due care and respect. The flat is to be left clean and tidy and keys posted through the letterbox.  Use of my home is for guests only, no extra visitors.
properties.host_about:
I've lived in Angel for 10 years and never tire of the area as there's something to do as soon as you step out of the house. In my younger days I spent nights clubbing and bar hopping in trendy Old Street, just up the road, but nowadays I love to catch the latest independent film at The Screen on The Green Cinema, just 3 minutes away, or just go for a bike ride or walk.

In my flat you will find a set of turntables and hundreds of vinyl records, which are a relic from my DJing days, I guess I was a bit of a party girl!

I love to travel (doesn't everyone), and my ideal destination would be Brazil. I've been to the states, Caribbean, Kenya, Gambia and Thailand.

One of my favourite books is The Prophet by Kahil Gibran, which is a kind of dummy's guide to living, but told through the wise words of a very wise fictional prophet.

Having me as a host I think you will feel taken care of, as I love to do my best to help and assist, and make any recommendations, and would generally try to make your stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible.

My life motto is that everything you go through is part of a bigger picture that you may never get to see. Knowing this really helps when something doesn't make sense. And I use this knowledge to trust that everything is working out for the greater good.
properties.street: Old Royal Free Square, London, N1 0YH, United Kingdom

Will, Thomas, Serena and Tom

properties.interaction: Two Spanish girls, studying English, live on the top floor but they have their own (second) kitchen and their own bathroom.
properties.house_rules: Have a great time!  You are welcome to use the BBQ and teak garden furniture, perfect for summer evenings. Also everything in the kitchen: 3 ovens, microwave, pots & pans, china, etc, as well as herbs & spices as you need.  Technology: We will set you up with wifi internet access (available across all 3 floors of the house and in the garden). You can use the very large plasma TV (to watch the games you don't have tickets for), DVD player and Wii. Let us know if you need any extras, such as baby equipment (cot, highchair, toys), child equipment (bikes, scooters, toys) or the kitchen stocked up with fresh food! Here's a room-by-room description. Ground Floor - private front garden with mature shrubs. Front hallway entrance, with 10 hook coat rack. Living room with over-sized plasma TV, DVD player and Wii, plus two comfortable weather-beaten brown leather sofas to lounge in. Enormous kitchen/diner. Kitchen is fully-equipped with triple over & grill, microwave, dishwasher, full-size fridge
properties.host_about:
We are a laid-back Canadian/British family, with three kids and an over-sized dog. We are laid-back about our home, we want it to be used and loved, so we don't get in a flap about breakages! We often/always have plenty of people staying - friends, family, friends of friends. We are very relaxed and love to have lots of people in the house.

Peter works for Tesco, which is the UK's biggest retail store, covering groceries, furniture, toys, gas/petrol/diesel and almost everything else. Michelle works within healthcare / pharmaceuticals and as a university lecturer/tutor. The kids go to school...

We love to travel, although we do less flights these days as the kids are still small. We have been to the US (we lived in Boston for 6 years), Canada (Peter was born in Toronto), Mexico, Guatamala, Belize, Costa Rica, Panama, Peru and Brasil in the Americas. In Asia, we have visited Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam and Burma (for a day!). Africa is close to Michelle's heart, as she lived in Kenya for a year. We have also spent time in Ethiopia, Tanzania, Malawi, Namibia, South Africa and Mali. Writing out this list makes me realise how lucky we are to have visited so many amazing places. We have also spent time in many European countries.

Michelle's life motto: "Today is not a dress rehearsal, it's the real thing. Live it."

We will be out of town over the Olympic season, but would like others to enjoy the fun!

properties.host_about: I am an international development consultant working with child health and education programmes in developing countries. I live with my husband and two children in a village just outside Cambridge, England. I have lived in Kenya and Hong Kong and I have worked in numerous countries in Africa, South Asia, South East Asia and the Far East. I have had this lovely flat since 1994 and have had long stay tenants (one stayed for 11 years) and short stay tenants, friends and family stay here too. properties.name: Luxury stay in Soho / Covent Garden at Seven Dials
properties.summary: Ever heard of Seven Dials? Nestled between Covent Garden and Soho, Leicester Square and Shaftesbury Avenue, it's the beating heart of the West End. And here's your chance to experience the best of London life, right in the very centre of it all....
properties.space: Seven Dials is a cute and quirky neighbourhood with a village feel centred on a sundial monument with seven streets radiating out from it. These seven streets are famously brimming with boutique shops and cafés, and since chain stores aren't permitted within a block of the sundial, it makes the area completely unique. The perfect location for exploring London by foot, and as central to London's tourist, shopping and nightlife hotspots as you can get. Read my reviews - nearly everyone talks about the location. Guests often tell me I've undersold it, and despite what I wrote they still can't believe the location when they're here. Lots of listings claim that they're central. You've found one that actually is :-) Absolutely ideal for tourists - all of the following are within a ten minute walk: British Museum, National Gallery, Covent Garden Piazza, Soho, Leicester Square, Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly Circus, the River Thames, Oxford Street, Regent Street, Carnaby Street, Shaftesbury Aven

properties.neighborhood_overview: This really is the most extraordinary place to stay - click the Street View tab above to take a look around. I've also highlighted some interesting and useful places nearby - please click the Guidebook icon above.
properties.notes: I'm a vegetarian and I request that you don't bring meat or fish products into the apartment; furthermore, fur is expressly forbidden, so you cannot bring fur into the apartment. There are dozens of cafés nearby catering to all palates and budgets. I'm gay, but very straight-friendly :-) I'm a nice guy and I'm happy to help you in any way I can to make your stay more enjoyable. I've lived in central London most of my adult life and I'm happy to advise on things to see and do. I've created a whirlwind two-hour circular walking tour covering many of the major sights that I can send you on (or perhaps even join you on) - first-time visitors to London usually love it. And it certainly doesn't take much to persuade me to join you in the pub! If three of you are staying and you don't all want to share the king bed, there is a single floor mattress that can be set up next to it. Note that the floor mattress is not usually available otherwise - if you would like it for two guests please discus
properties.transit: You're within a couple of minutes' walk of both Leicester Square and Covent Garden Underground stations - but if you stay here, you probably won't use "the tube" much - you're right in the thick of it all and can walk everywhere! When you book, you'll receive an automated email with detailed arrival instructions from all London airports and by Eurostar, as well as lots and lots of insider tips - it's well worth a careful read before you get here. I can also organise a licensed minicab pickup from the airport that's much cheaper than getting a taxi when you arrive - just ask.
properties.access: This is my home, but your room and ensuite bathroom are very private, since you don't have to pass through my lounge or bedroom to get there. In general you won't have access to elsewhere in the apartment, so no kitchen or lounge access, but you'll have your own keys and can come and go as you please. I also rent a second room in the apartment, it is smaller with a separate shared bathroom - to see it, click my name to view my profile, then at the bottom of the left column click "Double bed in Covent Garden / Soho".
properties.interaction: I'm very happy to help you kick off your London experience, with a walk around the neighbourhood, a beer or two perhaps, breakfast - whatever you feel like. If you want to keep yourself to yourself, that's perfectly fine too. Just let me know!
properties.house_rules: I'm a vegetarian and I request that you don't bring meat or fish products into the apartment; furthermore, fur is expressly forbidden, and if you arrive at my door with any fur you will be refused admission. There is no kitchen or communal areas access, although you have a kettle with tea and coffee and a drinks fridge in your room. I will try to work with you on mutually agreeable check-in and check-out times. If you have exact timescales in mind, please agree them with me before confirming your booking. Arrival after 11.30pm (scheduled or actual, and when possible and agreed) is an additional £25. Bag storage and/or checkin before midday, when possible and agreed, is an additional £10; similarly, checkout after midday and/or bag storage for later collection, when possible and agreed, is an additional £10. If you prefer, there are bag storage facilities at Charing Cross station nearby, which you can also prebook online. Remember that you are responsible for the behaviour of any guest
properties.host_about: Brit, 46, from London, love to travel and have visited 40 countries. I've been hosting with Airbnb since 2012 and I really enjoy it. So far I've hosted over 800 guests from countries including Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Israel, Italy, Luxembourg, Malaysia, New Zealand, Norway, Philippines, Russia, Serbia, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, UK, USA and Uruguay. I've also stayed in Brazil, Finland, France, Kenya, Spain and the USA as an Airbnb guest. I'm gay, vegetarian, politically left-wing and I believe in social justice and equality, And I do like a drink sometimes, so if you want someone to show you the pubs of London, you've come to the right profile! I'm a massive Arsenal fan, I go to every home match as a season ticket holder, and if you're here during a home match there's a chance I can get you tickets too given enough notice. Harry Potter's showing at the end of my block, I may be able to help with Cursed Child tickets too. Since 2016 I've been on a massive health kick, I've lost over 55 lbs / 25 kgs, in part by walking five miles every day. If you wanna join me on one of these walks, just ask - I'm always looking for company!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Canary Wharf: London's new financial district and upscale living. With 120 stores across 5 malls in Canary Wharf and almost 100 restaurants/bars, there's no shortage of activities.  (NB. we also have the best steak restaurant in London--Goodmans--2 minutes away). Free concerts and outdoor movies during summer months. Multiplex cinema. Relaxing strolls along the Thames and walking distance to Greenwich via the historic foot tunnel. Not to mention Mudchute park, a functioning farm.
properties.notes: If you are here to work in Canary Wharf or the City, you may know us or our connections through LinkedIn.
properties.transit: Canary Wharf is very well served by multiple forms of transportation:  1/ DLR (Docklands Light Rail)--goes to Bank Station, Stratford, Greenwich, and City Airport 2/ Jubilee Line--to central and West London, including an easy 1-change to Picadilly line for Heathrow Airport. 3/ Water buses--travel on the Thames with water buses, leaving from Westferry Circus (Four Seasons Hotel) 4/ Buses--yes, double-decker red buses

properties.neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill has a hip and cool village feel that makes it so unique.  Most noted for Portobello Market, the world's largest antiques market with over 1,000 dealers, you will also find countless fruit and vegetable stalls and second hand shops to browse.  There are also endless bars, cafes, shops and restaurants in the area and you will never tire of exploring. There is a local grocery store just near the tube station (8 minute walk) and small bodegas as well.  Though the area has gentrified significantly over the years, it still retains its Bohemian edge.  The Electric Cinema and restaurant is nearby and embodies all that is cool about this neighbourhood.

You will find numerous buses along Ladbroke Grove so getting around the city is effortless.  The closest bus stop is a 3 minute walk away. There is a grocery store and other shops just at the tube station (8 minute walk).

properties.neighborhood_overview: Wanstead has a lovely village feel and a great high street with a fantastic Butchers (The Ginger Pig), green grocers (Harveys) and fish mongers (Wanstead Fish) as well as a couple of pubs (The Cuckfield, The Duke and The George) and some lovely little restaurants (Otto, The Manor House pub) and convenience stores (Tesco & CO-OP) where you can get all the little bits you need. There's also a lovely green space for when it's sunny, complete with a children's play park and library. To get to all of these, take a left out of the flat, then a left at the end of the road and walk for 10 minutes until you reach a Santander bank on the corner. Take another left and you'll be on the high street and eventually the park will be on your left. You'll also see the tube station straight ahead when you reach Santander, should you want to head into the centre.

properties.summary: Welcome to our home! We might be a little biased but we think our three bedroom apartment has it all! We have a fun, contemporary and stylish design theme throughout so you will see lots of pops of colour and geometrical patterns in our interiors. The apartment is located on the border between Chelsea and Fulham and is just a one minute walk away from a tube stop. This is a ritzy west London neighbourhood with lots going on so you are right in the heart of all the hustle and bustle!
properties.space: This contemporary three bedroom apartment really has an amazing designer feel to it as the interiors are simplistic yet striking.  There is an open-plan living and dining area. Here you will find a huge leather L-shaped sofa, a flat screen TV with a paid Netflix subscription for guests to use, and a stylish monochromatic dining area. Make yourself at home in this area as you have plenty of space to put your feet up and relax after a long hard day of sightseeing in London.  The adjoined kitchen is full integrated and comes with all the mod-cons you might expect such as a toaster, kettle, microwave and dishwasher. We will also always provide plenty of tea, coffee and sugar so you can make yourself a traditional British cuppa. There are three bedrooms in the apartment, and they all have unique design themes. Bedroom number one has a black and white geometric theme, bedroom number two is bright and colourful and has lots of pops of yellow colour in it. Finally, bedroom three has a classic

properties.neighborhood_overview: Fulham is a great place to socialise, eat-out and explore. Take a short stroll to the local shops and try for yourself! There are a great number of coffee shops, local parks and there is a gym 5 minutes walk away which offers guest facilities and also plenty of drop-in fitness classes. If you are exploring West London you can walk to the River Thames and head over the river to Putney. Or if you want to head into the City to see the sites, simply jump on the district line from Fulham Broadway tube station which can take you to: - South Kensington for the museums - Sloane square for great shopping - Westminster for the Houses of Parliament The great Chelsea F.C. have their home stadium about 10 mins away from my home. If you are into shopping, then you head over to lovely Kings Road where you can shop at lots of nice high street stores. For the fashionistas with big budgets or even those who just want to do window shopping there is nothing like the Harrods - the most famous department st
properties.notes: This is a first floor apartment so please note that there are a few stairs to reach the property.
properties.transit: Closest transport links are Fulham Broadway tube station and/or Parson Green tube station for the district line. As well as various local buses. However I'd always say that walking is definitely the best way to explore the immediate, local area. As well as the nearby tube stations, there are also lots of buses that can connect you to the City and West End, allowing you to travel above ground. A great local tip is to download the Citymapper app. This free app will plan your journey for you efficiently and quickly. It gives you a variety of different transport options such as bike, rail, tube and Uber taxi. It will also take you step by step through your journey as you travel and notify you when you are nearing your destination.
properties.access: The entire apartment is available for guests.
properties.interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away. They are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to give you a warm welcome! Hostmaker will look after you. If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.
properties.house_rules: - This is an original Victorian building, and noise travels very easily. Please be sensible with noise and respectful of other residents in the building, especially after 10 p.m. If you return to the apartment after 10 p.m., please be considerate of other residents and keep your voices low. This is in accordance with the building rules. - The softwood floors are easily damaged. Please do not wheel luggage on floors. Please do not wear high heels or stilettos in the apartment. - Absolutely no overnight guests allowed except those confirmed with your reservation. - Thank you for cooperation. I hope you have a wonderful time in London.
properties.host_about:
A sailor, explorer, photographer, corporate strategist and a recovering banker, photographer, fashionista...and our two kids.

Confused travellers with three passports each, struggling to balance our desire for adventure with the need to keep all four safe. You can find us sailing around Cape Horn, rallying through India, running through Kenya...although lately it's more like Disneyland.

As a guest, I will treat your Home with the same respect I have for mine.

I work as a choral conductor; have a look at my website to check out what I'm up to at the moment. My little house is the centre of my world. When I'm in London I work from here most weeks and have rehearsals and meetings. It's a shame when I go away and it falls silent for weeks on end...

Tori

properties.neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is superbly located offering great access to the whole of London via Victoria Tube and Train station. The area has over 350 Grade II listed buildings and several Grade II* listed churches. There is also a lively Farmers Market every weekend which is not to be missed! The River Thames is on your doorstep with great views at night. Notable residents have included politician Winston Churchill, designer Laura Ashley, philosopher Swami Vivekananda, actor Laurence Olivier, illustrator and author Aubrey Beardsley, Kenyan nationalist Jomo Kenyatta and the inventor of lawn tennis, Major Walter Wingfield. We hope you will have a very pleasant stay in this upmarket and stylish London borough.

It is a 10 minute walk to the River Thames - with wonderful views of Chelsea Bridge.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is a tranquil area of central London, in the City of Westminster. Pimlico is known for its grand garden squares and impressive Regency architecture. It is a quiet, safe and tranquil neighbourhood, where you can easily walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament, Tate Britain and The Coca Cola London Eye.  Notable residents have included politician Winston Churchill, designer Laura Ashley, philosopher Swami Vivekananda, actor Laurence Olivier, illustrator and author Aubrey Beardsley, Kenyan nationalist Jomo Kenyatta and inventor of lawn tennis Major Walter Wingfield.
properties.notes: This room is really suitable for single occupancy.
properties.transit: Pimlico has excellent connections both day and night.  It is served by Pimlico station on the Victoria line and Victoria station on the Victoria, District and Circle lines. It is also served by National Rail services to London Victoria Station. Bus routes that run centrally through Pimlico are the 24, 360, and the C10. Many more buses run along Vauxhall Bridge Road to the East of Pimlico. Riverboat services to Waterloo and Southwark run from Millbank Millennium Pier. The area has a dozen docking stations for the Santander Cycle Hire scheme. AIRPORTS:  Heathrow 30 minutes by taxi, 40 minutes by Tube  Gatwick is 30 minutes by train from Victoria  Stansted buses leave from Victoria coach station

properties.neighborhood_overview: My place is within 5 minutes walking distance to Canary Wharf and 15 minutes from London City airport by DLR. The area itself dates back hundreds of years and you can find many historic streets, reflecting the old docklands, among the modern architecture. It is well worth taking a walking tour of the area and visiting near by historic pubs and restaurants such as the Prospect of Whitby and The Gun .  The Propect of Whitby stakes a claim to the title of London's oldest riverside pub whilst the The Gun is one of London's finest water-side restaurants. The area has fantastic shops and restaurants and is well connected by great transport links to other interesting parts of London such as the area around Tower Bridge and the City of London.
properties.notes: Th apartment does not have parking. There is limited street parking in the vicinity for resident permit holders except for weekends, evenings and public holidays.
properties.transit: Most amenities are in easy walking distance of my place including the Jubilee Line and DLR stations at Canary Wharf, Blackwall, Poplar etc.  There are frequent buses if you don't want to walk or take the tube or DLR.  The River boat service is within a 5 minute walk from my place to Canary Riverside.  The Riverboat is a great way to see London.  Another great way to see London is the Emirates Air Line Cable Car ride which will take you across the river to North Greenwich and the O2 with its restaurants and bars and can be reached within 10 minutes from my place by DLR from Blackwall station.  The views from the cable car are amazing.  You can visit historic maritime Greenwich, including the Cutty Sark and the Observatory by using the foot-tunnel near Island Gardens DLR station to cross the river Thames by  foot.  Island Gardens is about 10 minutes by DLR from my place.
properties.access: When you stay at my place you can make use of the entire apartment for your entire stay.  There will be fresh milk, bread, tea, coffee etc waiting for you in the well equipped kitchen. So feel free to cook up a meal if you don't want to eat out or order in every night.  There is a large Waitrose and a small Tesco in Canary Wharf to pick up fresh ingredients and supplies. But you can always pop down to The Gun pub and restaurant which is just round the corner on Coldharbour Lane, 3 minutes walk from my place.
properties.interaction: Keys can be collected from the concierge but you can contact me at any time by phone or email for assistance.
properties.host_about: Family man who works in the city.  My family and I love to travel, eat out and explore. I am originally from Kenya so our favorite trips include safari but we also enjoy exploring London on foot at weekends.  We go hiking to places such as the peak district and lake district.  We feel at home in the city and in the country.

properties.summary: A cosy basement studio on picturesque Talbot Road, this flat is perfect for couples or those with a young child looking to explore London while living like a local. Situated on a quiet road, the location is the perfect combination of central and quiet. With an abundance of pubs and restaurants just minutes from the house, as well as easy access by bus, tube or foot to Central London and all the major sights, there's good reason Notting Hill is one of the most desired areas to live in London!
properties.space: A cosy yet spacious studio flat, the space consists of a large living room/bedroom area with a separate kitchen and bathroom.  The flat has been recently redecorated, and you will find everything you need to be comfortable in this quiet haven. The flat is clean, bright and well maintained with fresh, good quality sheets and towels for every guest as well as shampoo, conditioner, body wash and moisturiser. If you want to cook, you will find the basics such as olive oil, salt and pepper, butter and spices. Other helpful amenities include a hair dryer, hangers, iron and ironing board, washing machine and dryer. Please note there is WiFi so you can watch films on your laptop/iPad but there is no TV in the flat.  There is a travel cot available on request for those with a child up to three years old.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Talbot Road is in a very trendy part of Notting Hill, just a two minute walk from fashionable Westbourne Grove where you can find a huge array of excellent restaurants, cosy pubs, and great breakfast spots as well as great shopping. Almost every kind of food is catered for, and I honestly believe that the nearby Chinese restaurant and Greek restaurant are two of the best in London. I have lots of eating and drinking tips for those who book with me.  Hyde Park is walking distance, as is Kensington where you can find the high street for shopping, plenty more restaurants and cafes, as well as the Royal Albert Hall, the V&A Museum, the Natural History Museum and so much more. If you love shopping, Oxford Street is just a few stops on the tube or 10 minutes on the bus, and you can get to Westfield Shopping Centre in White City in 15 minutes. Notting Hill is one of the premium areas to live in London – and you can be a local while you visit London! The area is much loved due to its beautiful
properties.notes: This flat is for up to two adults (if you have a young child, I can provide a travel cot). There is no sofa bed so I cannot accommodate extra people.  Please note that if you arrive after 6pm, I may ask you to come to my house to collect the keys. My house is one minute away from the flat, and you will pass it on the way from Royal Oak station so it's very easy.  If you smoke on the patio, please keep the front door shut, and put all cigarette ends in the ashtray.
properties.transit: Nearest tube station is Royal Oak (7 mins away) on the Hammersmith and City Line and takes you to Paddington, Baker Street, Euston Square, Kings Cross/St Pancras, and Liverpool Street, as well as many stops in between. Notting Hill Gate tube station (12 minutes) is on the Central Line, Circle Line and District taking you to loads of places such as Bond Street, Oxford Circus, Westminster, St Paul's and many more.  There are plenty of buses round the corner taking you into Central London, the museums, and Westfield shopping centre. It is also very easy to access all the major airports (Heathrow, Gatwick, Luton, Stansted) and train stations - Paddington is a 20 minute walk (or short bus ride), Victoria is five stops away, Kings Cross is six stops away, and Liverpool Street is 10 stops away! properties.host_about:
Hi! I'm Jessie, a born-and-bred Londoner living in Notting Hill with my little rescue dog, Roman. I love horse riding, experimenting with my hair colour (currently blue!) and also travelling.

So far some of my favourite countries are Iceland, Ethiopia, Palestine and Japan. This year I'll be visiting Panjab, Mongolia, Kenya, Uganda and wherever else I might find myself! 

I love my home city and have lived in the Notting Hill area my whole life, so I'm a bit of an expert on the place! As a host I hope to make you feel as at home as possible, and I am local to the flat meaning I can be on hand for whatever you need. 

Please feel free to ask me any questions - I look forward to meeting you!

The ideal location within easy reach of London’s top attractions, Hyde Park, the West End & Kensington. Please note the flat is on the top floor, up three flights of stairs (there is no lift).
properties.space: A newly decorated two double bedroom flat, with everything you need to feel at home and welcome in London. properties.neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill is one of the most iconic areas of London and is without a doubt the ideal place to stay in London. The famous Portobello Market is just a stone's throw from the flat, selling antiquities, clothes and street-food. The area is a hub of traditional English pubs, cool bars and quality restaurants. It is also very central making it easy to access other parts of London. Notting Hill is a relaxed and safe area where you will feel comfortable walking home from the tube station at night. There is so much choice on Portobello Rd, and below are just a few of my favourite places to eat and drink. In the flat, there are many more recommendations, complete with maps showing you exactly how to get there. Butter Bakery : right across the road, has a brilliant selection of pastries for breakfast or a snack, with aromatic coffee and fresh juices. Ripe Tomato : a family-run restaurant just round the corner which serves fantastic Italian food. Make sure you leave room for pudding!  Raoul’s :
properties.notes: The flat is on the top floor, and there are quite a few staircases to climb, and no elevator access. This does mean it is very quiet though! If you have a buggy, this can safely be left on the first landing (we know all the other tenants so it will be safe.)
properties.transit: Westbourne Park station is a five minute walk, and takes you to areas such as Paddington, Baker Street, Euston Square, Kings Cross/St Pancras and Liverpool Street.  Notting Hill Gate station is a ten minute walk, and from there you have a choice of three underground lines, taking you almost anywhere in London!  There are also plenty of buses if you prefer the scenic route. I have been travelling round London my whole life so if you want to know the best way to get somewhere, just ask me! I suggest you get an Oyster Card as soon as you get to London, for easy travelling. From the flat you can easily get to: Portobello Market (3 min walk) Madame Tussauds (15 mins by tube) Kensington Palace (20 min walk) Hyde Park (20 min walk) Buckingham Palace (30 min by tube) Natural History Museum (20 min by bus) Science Museum (20 min by bus) Kings Cross St Pancras (15 min by tube) Oxford Street (30 min by bus) Soho (35 min by bus) Harrods (30 min by tube) Westminster Abbey / Big Ben (25 min by tube)
properties.access: The entire flat is for our guests' use. I will come and meet you and hand over the keys, and answer any questions you have. I ask that you treat the flat as you would your home. I am happy for you to have friends over for a meal, and enjoy the flat but please leave it clean and tidy. Unfortunately we cannot allow dogs (even though we love them!) The building contains other flats where working Londoners live, so we do ask that you are quiet during the evening.
properties.interaction: I live and work just down the road, and will be happy to assist you with any needs. Check in is 2pm and check out is 11am however I can be flexible depending on availability, so just ask and I will try and accommodate where possible.
properties.house_rules: Please do not smoke in the flat. It has just recently been completely redecorated so I ask that you treat the flat as you would your own home. properties.neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is superbly located offering great access to the whole of London via Victoria Tube and Train station. The area has over 350 Grade II listed buildings and several Grade II* listed churches. There is also a lively Farmers Market every weekend which is not to be missed! The River Thames is on your doorstep with great views at night. Notable residents have included politician Winston Churchill, designer Laura Ashley, philosopher Swami Vivekananda, actor Laurence Olivier, illustrator and author Aubrey Beardsley, Kenyan nationalist Jomo Kenyatta and the inventor of lawn tennis, Major Walter Wingfield. We hope you will have a very pleasant stay in this upmarket and stylish London borough.

The convenient & hassle free process, and the warmth & generosity of the hosts - it was in this vein that we setup The London Residents Club. 

We look after a small number of homes belonging to family and friends - we host them as if they were our own. We will always strive to ensure that your experience is hassle free:

Best wishes,

Will, Thomas, Serena and Tom

properties.neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is a tranquil area of central London, in the City of Westminster. Pimlico is known for its grand garden squares and impressive Regency architecture. It is a quiet, safe and tranquil neighbourhood, where you can easily walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament, Tate Britain and The Coca Cola London Eye.  Notable residents have included politician Winston Churchill, designer Laura Ashley, philosopher Swami Vivekananda, actor Laurence Olivier, illustrator and author Aubrey Beardsley, Kenyan nationalist Jomo Kenyatta and inventor of lawn tennis Major Walter Wingfield.
properties.notes: There is an additional charge of £25 per night for the second guest
properties.transit: Pimlico has excellent connections both day and night.  It is served by Pimlico station on the Victoria line and Victoria station on the Victoria, District and Circle lines. It is also served by National Rail services to London Victoria Station. Bus routes that run centrally through Pimlico are the 24, 360, and the C10. Many more buses run along Vauxhall Bridge Road to the East of Pimlico. Riverboat services to Waterloo and Southwark run from Millbank Millennium Pier. The area has a dozen docking stations for the Santander Cycle Hire scheme. AIRPORTS:  Heathrow 30 minutes by taxi, 40 minutes by Tube  Gatwick is 30 minutes by train from Victoria  Stansted buses leave from Victoria coach station

properties.host_about:
I am an interior designer, and I spend half my time between London and Tuscany, Italy, where my villa is also available to rent on Air B'n'B. I have a passion for colour, culture and all things unique and interesting, and I enjoy visiting museums and exhibitions as I am always looking for things to inspire me. I have two daughters in their early twenties. One has flown the nest, while the other is at University so is back home in the holidays. 
I enjoy travelling and visiting new places. The last place I went to was Sicily. but i love India, Kenya & America. Best of all Rome, where I go often. 
I love the cinema and boxed sets. I am watching Homeland and The Americans at the moment and can't wait for the new season of Parenthood. I love Max. I think I am sounding  like a real loser. 
I wish I was more sporty but I do at least do Yoga twice a week. I like food and am a good cook particularly of Italian food having lived in Italy for many years. 
I love to read most of all and have just finished The Interestings by Meg Wollitzer. I like American writers, Joyce Carol Oates, Saul Bellow, Phillip Roth, AM Holmes.  
I love beautiful houses and my favourite thing of all is finding things at junk shops.

I am usually quite cheerful and laid back and I think you will like staying here. It has a nice homely and relaxed atmosphere at the same time as being clean and quiet.  

I don't have a motto but generally I think 'just do it'.

properties.neighborhood_overview: It's all about location, location, location with my house! You will be right in the heart of all the action and the famous London landmarks here. Westminster is definitely a distinct political and cultural epicentre. Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Parliament and the towering Big Ben will all be on your doorstep :) How's that for a sightseeing lover! And of course if that's not enough then you can walk along the Thames and take in the hustle and bustle or walk to Covent Garden in less than 30 minutes! Nearby across the river, there are world-famous theatres such as Shakespeare's Globe, the BFI IMAX and sky-high dining at the OXO Tower, plenty of great pubs and even a bit of parkland! Is this isn't enough then culture vultures will love that the Imperial War Museum is also within walking distance and you can easily spend an enjoyable morning/afternoon or even whole day here! If international food markets are more then your thing then you are in luck! Borough food mar
properties.notes: Please note that although there is a private balcony, this is not safe for children and it should not be used. In an emergency this balcony is a fire escape so I will leave a key in a specified place. I am afraid the garage is not for guest use.
properties.transit: Westminster underground is an 11 minute walk away. This station is served by the Circle, District and Jubilee lines. Alternatively, St James Park underground is a 10 minute walk away and it is served by the District and Circle lines. Victoria and Waterloo mainline stations are also close by.  Bus routes C10 to Canary Wharf/Victoria, 507 to Waterloo/Victoria, 88 to West End from Marsham Street (two minute walk). Buses are a great way of travelling if you like to have a peek at your surroundings as you travel.  A great local tip is to download the Citymapper app. This free app will plan your journey for you efficiently and quickly. It gives you a variety of different transport options such as bike, rail, tube and Uber taxi. It will also take you step by step through your journey as you travel and notify you when you are nearing your destination.

We love to travel and visit Kenya regularly where one of our sons is based. We hope you like our home and its location as much as we do.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is a tranquil area of central London, in the City of Westminster. Pimlico is known for its grand garden squares and impressive Regency architecture. It is a quiet, safe and tranquil neighbourhood, where you can easily walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament, Tate Britain and The Coca Cola London Eye.  Notable residents have included politician Winston Churchill, designer Laura Ashley, philosopher Swami Vivekananda, actor Laurence Olivier, illustrator and author Aubrey Beardsley, Kenyan nationalist Jomo Kenyatta and inventor of lawn tennis Major Walter Wingfield.
properties.transit: Pimlico has excellent connections both day and night.  It is served by Pimlico station on the Victoria line and Victoria station on the Victoria, District and Circle lines. It is also served by National Rail services to London Victoria Station. Bus routes that run centrally through Pimlico are the 24, 360, and the C10. Many more buses run along Vauxhall Bridge Road to the East of Pimlico. Riverboat services to Waterloo and Southwark run from Millbank Millennium Pier. The area has a dozen docking stations for the Santander Cycle Hire scheme. AIRPORTS:  Heathrow 30 minutes by taxi, 40 minutes by Tube  Gatwick is 30 minutes by train from Victoria  Stansted buses leave from Victoria coach station

I'm a freelance musician living in London, also interested in entrepreneurship and film. My work takes me away from home a lot, and so I've just started advertising my home to share on AirBnB.

I've camped on mountains and lived with a Maasai community in Kenya, so I'm not one to shy away from new experiences, and I believe that where you stay is a key factor which contributes towards your impression of a new place.

I work as a choral conductor; have a look at my website to check out what I'm up to at the moment. My little house is the centre of my world. When I'm in London I work from here most weeks and have rehearsals and meetings. It's a shame when I go away and it falls silent for weeks on end...

Tori

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Kings Road and Chelsea are famous for the shopping, dinning and architecture. The area is quiet and safe away from the serious hustle and bustle of the main touristic areas. Science mueseum, V&A and natural history museums are an enjoyable 30minite stroll or you can walk to the bus and take a ride that way. Buses take you direct to Soho, Westminster, Liverpool street for brick lane and Shoreditch. London is one of the largest sprawling cities with large parks at fairly regular intervals so please be sure to consider it's vastness when planning your journies as some are surprised by how much time can be spent travelling.
properties.notes: Traditional gas cooker and oven  Power shower that was installed a few years ago as the pressure in the building was very bad before, trick is to turn on the shower then boost pressure by turning on the sink tap briefly.  We don't have curtains as we like to be able to admire such an incredible and unusually lucky view of London so if you need something put up please do let us know and we can arrange. The beds in the bedrooms are on platforms as the pictures show so small children who wriggle might want to sleep on the inside, no one has ever fallen out to date.  There are two bins, one with a lid is for general waste that goes down the shoot just outside and to the right of the front door. The second bin is without a lid and is for clean recyclables only that can be disposed of in the communal containers in the car park below the tower (card board, paper, plastic, metal and glass) If you need extra towels please ask before using so we can point you towards the guest towels of which th
properties.transit: There are bus stops are a three to seven minute walk for access to other areas and tube and train stations. The closest tube is 15minute walk but you can take a bus to shorten the journey. There is also a bike hire dock on the estate so you can enjoy london by bike easily.

properties.host_about:
Hi my name is Tatu,

Private health food chef, cyclist, yoga teacher in training, naturopathic nutritionist, Kenyan/British, warm friendly generally happy and hard working. Travel fairly regularly and love AirBnB experiences both hosting and travelling.
I read, run, walk, cook, cook, cook, cook as well as cycle and drink heaps of tea love to swim, practice yoga, climb, explore, find the best restaurant around. I am relaxed and friendly, busy but rarely frantic unless I am trying to finish and assignment in which case I am a flapping panick of a person! pottering is more my style.

I don't need much, a good shower, a nice view, delicious 100% cooton sheets and I always prefer gas cooker being a chef. I Don't much need hair dryers and microwaves and so on so I as a guest I am pretty easy and as a host you might want to consider bringing your own hair dryer - microwaves could be tricky :-)

properties.space: This flat is full of  rustic charm and modern conveniences.  The private garden is a jewel in the city, offering relaxing outdoor space.   Original Victorian features such as hardwood floors throughout and fireplaces are paired with modern amenities like recessed lights and new cooker stove.  The bathroom’s centerpiece is the beautiful claw foot tub with a prime view of the lush garden.    The flat comfortably sleeps four with a double bed in the bedroom and a pullout sofa in the lounge.  The open plan lounge offers great space to entertain while in the  kitchen or large dining table.  All kitchen items are provided including dishes, utensils, pots/pans and dishwasher.  There is also a washing machine for your convenience.  Towels and bed linens are also provided.

properties.name: Double bed in Covent Garden / Soho at Seven Dials
properties.summary: An ideal choice for the budget-conscious traveller looking for a great-value room with all the benefits of this unbelievable location right in the heart of London's West End. Read my reviews - dozens will reassure you there's no finer spot in town!!
properties.space: This room is perfect for one, and cosy for two, at 92 square feet / 8.1 square metres, with a small double bed (4" x 6"3, 120cm x 187cm), handmade by the famous British bedmaker Warren Evans. It has a floor-to-ceiling patio door that opens onto a Juliet balcony, which overlooks the alleyway. Bedding and huge fluffy towels from the luxury Egyptian cotton range at my favourite department store John Lewis, with both soft and firm anti-allergy pillows, and an anti-allergy duvet. A desk with a huge mirror and dressing-room-style lights above it. Your room has a kettle with Fairtrade-certified tea and coffee. A fan if you need it, ditto a heater. Huge soft Egyptian cotton towels for the bathroom, toiletries, a hairdryer, and an alarm clock. A guidebook I've written to give you some ideas and get you acquainted with the neighbourhood. properties.neighborhood_overview: The location - Seven Dials, between Covent Garden and Soho and right in the heart of London's West End - absolutely cannot be beaten. Read my reviews - nearly everyone talks about the location. Guests often tell me I've undersold it, and despite what I wrote they still can't believe the location when they're here. Lots of listings claim they're central. You've found one that actually is :-) Absolutely ideal for tourists - all of the following are within a ten minute walk: British Museum, National Gallery, Covent Garden Piazza, Soho, Leicester Square, Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly Circus, the River Thames, Oxford Street, Regent Street, Carnaby Street, Shaftesbury Avenue, and all the major West End theatres. Harry Potter fans: The Cursed Child is under a minute's walk away, and visible from my front door. It's bustling with life during the day, but surprisingly quiet at night - all the nearby pubs close at 11pm and the late-night clubs and bars, whilst close enough for you to easily walk
properties.notes: I'm a vegetarian and I request that you don't bring meat or fish products into the apartment; furthermore, fur is expressly forbidden, so you cannot bring fur into the apartment. There are dozens of cafés nearby catering to all palates and budgets. It's thanks to Airbnbers like you that I was recently able to afford an amazing new boiler, with heating on-demand so the hot water never runs out. It's situated in this bedroom, since gas boilers these days must be directly connected to an external vent. It's about as modern and quiet as it's possible for a boiler to be, but you will hear it clicking into life sometimes. I'm gay, but very straight-friendly :-) I'm a nice guy and I'm happy to help you in any way I can to make your stay more enjoyable. I've lived in central London most of my adult life and I'm happy to advise on things to see and do. I've created a whirlwind two-hour circular walking tour covering many of the major sights that I can send you on (or perhaps even join you on) -
properties.transit: You're within a couple of minutes' walk of both Leicester Square and Covent Garden Underground stations - but if you stay here, you probably won't use "the tube" much - you're right in the thick of it all and can walk everywhere! When you book, you'll receive an automated email with detailed arrival instructions from all London airports and by Eurostar, as well as lots of insider tips - it's well worth a careful read before you get here. I can also organise a licensed minicab pickup from the airport much cheaper than getting a taxi when you arrive. Any questions, please ask me.
properties.access: If you need more space with an en-suite bathroom, please consider my other listing - to see it, click my name to view my profile, then at the bottom of the left column click "Luxury stay in Soho / Covent Garden". This is my home, and the bathroom (with toilet, bath and shower) is shared with me, but your room is private, since you don't have to pass through my lounge or bedroom to get there. In general you won't have access to elsewhere in the apartment, so no kitchen or lounge access, but you'll have your own keys and can come and go as you please.
properties.interaction: I'm very happy to help you kick off your London experience, with a walk around the neighbourhood, a beer or two perhaps, breakfast - whatever you feel like. If you want to keep yourself to yourself, that's perfectly fine too. Just let me know!
properties.house_rules: Remember, this is a small room with a shared bathroom and an alleyway view, a small double bed, and a quiet-but-not-silent boiler. If you need more space with a private bathroom, a kingsize bed and a great view, please consider my main listing instead. I'm a vegetarian and I request that you don't bring meat or fish products into the apartment; furthermore, fur is expressly forbidden, and if you arrive at my door with any fur you will be refused admission. There is no kitchen or communal areas access, although you have a kettle with tea and coffee in your room. I will try to work with you on mutually agreeable check-in and check-out times. If you have exact timescales in mind, please agree them with me before confirming your booking. Arrival after 11.30pm (scheduled or actual, and when possible and agreed) is an additional £25. Bag storage and/or checkin before midday, when possible and agreed, is an additional £10; similarly, checkout after midday and/or bag storage for later collecti
properties.host_about: Brit, 46, from London, love to travel and have visited 40 countries. I've been hosting with Airbnb since 2012 and I really enjoy it. So far I've hosted over 800 guests from countries including Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Israel, Italy, Luxembourg, Malaysia, New Zealand, Norway, Philippines, Russia, Serbia, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, UK, USA and Uruguay. I've also stayed in Brazil, Finland, France, Kenya, Spain and the USA as an Airbnb guest. I'm gay, vegetarian, politically left-wing and I believe in social justice and equality, And I do like a drink sometimes, so if you want someone to show you the pubs of London, you've come to the right profile! I'm a massive Arsenal fan, I go to every home match as a season ticket holder, and if you're here during a home match there's a chance I can get you tickets too given enough notice. Harry Potter's showing at the end of my block, I may be able to help with Cursed Child tickets too. Since 2016 I've been on a massive health kick, I've lost over 55 lbs / 25 kgs, in part by walking five miles every day. If you wanna join me on one of these walks, just ask - I'm always looking for company!

properties.host_about:
Hello I'm Wendy a part-time teacher of children with literacy difficulties. I also have a CELTA qualification for teaching English. 
My husband John is also working part-time.
Our children are in their 20s and come and go! 

We have had several great Air BnB trips to France, Yorkshire, Vienna,Barcelona and Brighton so we thought we would enjoy hosting ourselves.

When travelling we like to stay with friends, in apartments or on campsites. We also love Neilson activity holidays and staying at our holiday home in Ireland.
I support a charity in Kenya sponsoring children to attend school. I visit every year to do teacher training and enjoy some winter sun.
 In my spare time I like walking pilates, swimming, playing Bridge and meeting up with friends for dinner.
 
I can speak basic Greek, French and Spanish (much better at reading than speaking )
John is fluent in French.

properties.name: Romantic Central London Retreat
properties.summary: Cosy, beautiful, quiet, spacious, light, 2nd floor tree-top flat with 90ft garden in conservation area. Victoria/Piccadilly/Oxford St: 3/4/5 stops on Victoria line - now 24hr running at w'ends. Easy for Kings Cross/West End. Cool Brixton/Clapham nearby. Zone 2 Stockwell tube 8mins walk. Free parking.
properties.space: Beautiful, 2 bedroom, 2nd floor flat with magical garden in mid-Victorian detached property in the peaceful and convenient conservation area of Stockwell, with wide, tree-lined streets and free parking (think 'My Fair Lady' with period lamp posts!).     This is the perfect place for a romantic or family city-break in London, either to stay and relax in the flat and spacious garden, to have as a base to explore the city, or otherwise use as an overnight stop if you've reason to be in London for a few days on business. You can be on Moorgate EC1 or at Covent Garden Piazza within 30 mins.     The flat is clean and bright, with a cosy, traditional English country feel.  We have antique decoration and an open fireplace in the sitting room, though we would need to be here in person for you to use the fire. Please note also that we do not have a TV. A musician and a photographer, we have put much love and thought into our home, wanting it to be a place to enjoy aesthetically as well as being

properties.neighborhood_overview: Stockwell conservation area is a hidden and beautiful collection of seven streets, with grand, mid-Victorian villas and wide, sunny roads. It's leafy and tree-lined, yet walkable to the buzz of Brixton and Clapham Old Town and central London is a short tube or bus ride away: you can be on Piccadilly in 22 mins from our door.  • There are several blue plaques on houses near us marking their famous former residents. Among them, Lilian Bayliss of Sadlers Wells fame had a home nearby, and Vincent Van Gogh's house was around the corner when he lived in London; he wrote to his brother describing the beauty of the area and his walks here. Where we are is a lovely blend of a countryside English feel, yet only 25 minutes from our door to Leicester Square and the West End, and we love the peace of home and the convenience of being 3 tube stops from Victoria. • This area is also known as Little Portugal and there is a great community of shops nearby, with a deli up the road 4 mins walk away selli
properties.notes: Easy access to Stockwell tube we have explained, but we are also a 3 min walk to the bus stop at the end of our road, with several bus routes going to Brixton - a 5 min ride away.  Enjoy the vibrancy and fun of glass-covered Brixton Village, Market Row, Pop Brixton and the outdoor Brixton Market, boasting a labyrinth of wonderful coffee shops; vintage & retro outlets; fruit/veg stalls; butchers/fishmongers; artisan cheese shops; cakes; countless restaurants from around the world; music and fantastic street life.  You won't be disappointed - it has been voted the best private market in the UK! • Another nearby hotspot is Clapham High Street.  Again, this area is teeming with bars, restaurants and coffee shops.  Like Brixton, Clapham has a Picture House cinema and both are great places to take in an arty movie or live-streamed opera. Buses from outside Lidl supermarket and Stockwell tube go to Clapham. Omnibus arts centre in Clapham offers good quality, live classical music. • Also near:
properties.transit: Cars and Parking...    From 5:30pm on Fridays, free parking is easily available all weekend immediately outside our house, until 8:30am on Monday morning. • If you are coming to us by car Mon-Fri, we are able to provide free daily parking permits on request. There is plenty of space in the marked bays immediately outside the house. • Groveway is off the A3 or Clapham Rd. Turn up Stockwell Park Rd or off Brixton Rd. Metered/phone parking is available around the corner if you have visitors during the week and any visitors needing just to pop in and out are welcome to park briefly in the house drive. Tube...    Stockwell tube is 8 mins walk away and is on the Victoria (blue) and Northern (black) lines. London Victoria rail station (and the tube stop) is 3 tube stops away, where the Gatwick Express comes into the city from the airport. • Otherwise, access to the City of London via the Bank Branch of the Northern line is 25 mins from our door to Bank/London Bridge. properties.access: You would have sole use of the flat, comprising double sleigh-bed main bedroom and second bedroom with bed height inflatable mattresses; sitting-room; kitchen; bathroom and hall. properties.interaction: If we are not at home during your stay we will be only a phone call or email away should you want to ask us anything. Swift, on-site practical assistance may be possible through our neighbors, local friends and lovely cleaning ladies.       If we are at home you will be warmly welcomed. Having been Londoners for many years we are happy to help advise on how best to see the city - both the famous sights and some of London's more hidden treasures. Normally we would be away during your stay or possibly nearby in London, but we will not typically need access to the flat at all whilst you are here.
properties.house_rules: • We ask that our guests do not smoke in the flat. • We also ask that people are quiet when coming and going from the house, being mindful of our neighbors in the other three flats. A special request: • please do not bang the front door. • The garden is communal to the house and you are welcome to enjoy it.  Please be friendly to neighbors who may be using it also or may be sleeping within earshot. • We ask that guests would strip the bed and leave the rooms and bathroom in good order at the end of their stay. • If you are staying we ask you not to have any overnight extra guests, but you are welcome to invite up to 4 guests back for dinner or a meal etc at the flat. If you wish to entertain more than that number we would like to discuss this with you first. ¤ One small extra request - please let us know when you've arrived safely at the flat! A quick text would set our minds at rest and mean we can turn our phones off for the night...
properties.host_about:
My husband is a musician and I'm a photographer.  Justin is a bass singer, composer, organist, pianist and harpist.  I photograph in a documentary style and shoot weddings, portraits, families, events and corporate shots. 

Having traveled extensively over the years some of the countries we've enjoyed are:  India; Kenya; Israel; Turkmenistan; Mongolia; Belize; Guatemala; Turkey; France; Spain; Russia to name but a few.  

We enjoy entertaining and sharing our home with friends and having wonderful parties in the garden.  Our shared love of rummaging in antique and vintage shops and buying beautiful furniture (that is not so precious you can't live with it easily) has meant that at our marriage, three years ago, our styles blended well together and our home is a reflection of who we are as a couple.

As with our family and friends, we want you to feel at home when you come to stay with us.  We are open and warm.  We enjoy good conversation and getting to know people from all walks of life.

We love that our flat is quiet and yet so centrally and beautifully situated.  We can be in the heart of the historic or financial city of London, the Houses of Parliament, Oxford Circus or Chelsea within 25 minutes because we have a choice of two underground lines from our nearest tube, Stockwell Station.

We know the nooks and crannies, the best place to eat at 3am, the swaggiest places in the East End, the coolest shows and shopping streets of the West End, the quiet coffee shops, the best English breakfasts. We are passionate about food and the first places that we look up in a new city are always restaurants or cafes! Also love a good jazz or classical concert.

properties.host_about:
I'm a huge fan of travelling! Since I was 12 years old, I've been travelling with my family, friends, and on my own all around the world. Although there isn't a single experience I didn't love, the ones that stand out the most are Kenya with my family, doing the GR11 in the Pyrenees, and backpacking across South America on my own for a year and a half.

I also love the outdoors and any sport in nature: skiing, mountaineering, fishing, and I really want to learn to windsurf this year. I also love cooking and trying new foods. I'm a very independent and self-sufficient person. I love meeting new people especially when backpacking or hitchhiking. 

Although I'm only now creating an airbnb account, I've stayed at various apartments with friends through airbnb and everything has always gone really well. As a guest, I like to feel at home where I'm staying but I'm very respectful and always leave the place clean and tidy when I leave. 

Looking forward to airbnb travelling!
