properties.neighborhood_overview: Parsons Green is a friendly, relaxed neighbourhood centered around a lovely little park (the Green). It’s popular with young professionals and families. There are several grocery stores and supermarkets (including a large Waitrose and one of the few Whole Foods in London) within easy walking distance as well as a traditional butcher on New King’s Road and a Sunday farmer's market. The area is home to numerous restaurants, including the iconic White Horse pub, a great champagne bar (Amuse Bouche), and London's only Michelin-starred gastropub (The Harwood Arms). New King's Road with its boutiques, restaurants, and antique shops borders the Green and is only a few minutes' walk away. There are several gyms and a cinema nearby.
properties.notes: Check-in time is usually after 3pm. And Check-out time is usually before 11am. But let us know if you would like to arrive or leave at a different time, and we will try our best to accommodate.. The deposit is £400 (fully refundable minus any phone charges assuming nothing is damaged or broken).
properties.transit: Located in a quiet cul-de-sac on a private road in Parsons Green, the flat is a few minutes’ walk away from shops and restaurants. It’s literally around the corner from the Parsons Green Tube station on the District Line – 20-30 minutes to central London and 10 minutes from Wimbledon if you're here for the tennis. Two 24-hour bus routes (14 and 22) stop about a block away (key if you like late nights out, as the Tube shuts down shortly after midnight!).
properties.access: Guests have full access to everything in the flat - all I ask is that if something runs out it is replaced on a like for like basis. It's your home while you're in London!
properties.interaction: The flat is only available when I am away on business or during the holidays, so you will have the space entirely to yourself! A selection of local maps and guidebooks are available to help you explore London, and I'm happy to make restaurant recommendations.
properties.house_rules: Essentially it boils down to the simple principle of 'treat my home the way you would want me to treat yours'.  Please note that this is a strictly non-smoking flat. I have asthma and I'm very sensitive to tobacco smoke, so I cannot let smokers stay here -- even if they did not smoke inside the chemicals cling to clothing and hair and would end up affecting the mattress, linens, and furniture.  No large / loud parties please!  Unfortunately I cannot accommodate pets.
properties.host_about:
I'm a former academic (Harvard, Cambridge, Oxford) and management consultant currently running Timeless Africa, a luxury travel company focusing on tailormade travel to sub-Saharan Africa. I also serve on a number of boards for Africa-focused non-profits focusing on challenges in education and conservation.

My main hobbies are photography, food and wine, and (of course) travel! I've travelled extensively in Europe, North America, and sub-Saharan Africa, including Botswana, Namibia, South Africa, Kenya, Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe. I'm a serious amateur travel and wildlife photographer who has exhibited at the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History in Washington, D.C. and I collect contemporary sculpture (primarily African) and antique maps and prints, which are scattered throughout my flat. Let me know if you want any restaurant recommendations while you're in London!

Also, it is close to tourist attraction such as the Beatles Studios (a must), Camden Town market, Little Venice area ... and others corners that are worth being discovered and are not on the typical tourists' map. I can provide indications for those.

properties.host_about:
Hello I'm Wendy a part-time teacher of children with literacy difficulties. I also have a CELTA qualification for teaching English. 
My husband John is also working part-time.
Our children are in their 20s and come and go! 

We have had several great Air BnB trips to France, Yorkshire, Vienna,Barcelona and Brighton so we thought we would enjoy hosting ourselves.

When travelling we like to stay with friends, in apartments or on campsites. We also love Neilson activity holidays and staying at our holiday home in Ireland.
I support a charity in Kenya sponsoring children to attend school. I visit every year to do teacher training and enjoy some winter sun.
 In my spare time I like walking pilates, swimming, playing Bridge and meeting up with friends for dinner.
 
I can speak basic Greek, French and Spanish (much better at reading than speaking )
John is fluent in French.

properties.space: The flat has the convenience of its own entrance and private garden. It is unusually spacious and light, decorated with fascinating pieces of art from Kenya and other parts of Africa. On arrival into the pleasant entrance hall, you will find the master bedroom immediately to the left. Generously sized and furnished with a double bed, it also has the comfort of a modern en-suite shower room. Located adjacent is the main bathroom which also has a walk-in shower. The kitchen is a good-sized space with an every day dining table and modern facilities which include an American-style fridge, gas hob and double oven. Further along the corridor is the guest double bedroom, and at the rear the spacious living room with its access to the patio garden. properties.neighborhood_overview: The property is situated just off Old Brompton Road, a historical street where Lady Diana lived before her marriage to the Prince of Wales. It is also home to the famous Drayton Arms pub, a grade 2 listed building with an upstairs fringe theatre. There is an excellent selection of restaurants, bars and pubs along the road, such as the bohemian Troubadour, one of the last remaining coffee houses in London, now a thriving café which continues to host live music and poetry.
properties.notes: The 2 double bedrooms and a double sofa bed in the living area are used to accommodate 6 guests. The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old. Normal check in time is between 3pm and 9pm. All other times may incur an additional fee.
properties.transit: Within a 15 minute walk or short bus ride, you can reach the three South Kensington Museums, which are all highly recommended. Neighbouring Chelsea can also be reached within a short bus ride for its stylish selection of boutiques and eateries along the King’s Road and Sloane Square. With Earl’s Court station on your doorstep it couldn’t be easier to get around town; the District line will take you to Tower Hill whilst the Piccadilly line is ideal for reaching Harrods in Knightsbridge, and Leicester Square in the West End.
properties.house_rules: - The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. This is for insurance purposes to say that the guests will look after the property and not smoke or have parties - Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old - Normal check in time is between 3pm and 9pm. Any time outside of this period may incur an additional fee - No pets, no parties or smoking, please
properties.host_about:
Greetings from London! 
 
My name is Tom and along with my team I manage this collection of hand-picked apartments and houses for their individual owners while they are away. Each property is carefully selected and offers a stylish living experience and excellent value. 

As a lifelong Londoner I love having the opportunity to share these spaces, my knowledge and personal recommendations about this great city with those visiting for both short and long term stays. 

All our guests will be greeted personally at the property by a member of our hospitality team, and guest assistance is also provided by our professional customer service team between 8am - 8pm 7 days a week, should any issues arise during your stay. Please note that once a booking is made, the customer service team will be the point of contact thereafter.

Please be aware that viewings are not possible for stays of less than 1 month.
  
If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me and I will be sure to answer them promptly.
